newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish car registrations up 24.6 pct in Dec.
newsitem.headline: Swedish car registrations up 24.6 pct in Dec.

text.p: Swedish car registrations rose by 24.6 percent in December compared with the same month in 1995 for an annual rise of 14.3 percent, Statistics Sweden said on Thursday.
The number of cars registered in December rose to 18,956. Of these 17,242 were models from the years 1995-1997 while the rest were earlier models.
SCB said in 1996 there was 200,154 cars registered during the year.
An increase of almost 53 percent was noted for lorries in December compared with the same month a year earlier. The number registered rose to 2,500.
SCB said the number of trucks registered in 1996 reached 21,062 which was a rise of 43 percent on a year earlier.
